title: CLEP College Pre-Calculus
headline: This free online course provides an introduction to pre-calculus and shows you how to determine mathematical functions.
description: This course has been specially designed for college students to help them prepare for advanced levels of calculus. You will be introduced to fundamental principles and theories relevant to pre-calculus in a series of free online modules. There are no subscription or registration fees so enroll today to improve your math grades.
courseDescription:
Students often struggle with mathematics because they perceive it as a complex subject, especially branches such as numerical analysis, trigonometry, and algebra, all of which have fundamental workings in pre-calculus. Calculus is an integral part of science and technology. It needs to be understood from a basic level, then used for the correct derivation of complex theories in economics, environmental analysis, nuclear science, and engineering. To help you grasp calculus, the sub-branch of pre-calculus breaks down the building blocks of this important part of college math.

In this course, you will learn how to evaluate various mathematical functions, including exponential, polynomial, rational, logarithmic, and algebraic functions. Learners will evaluate these functions by understanding their definitions, workings, and sample problems. The workings of each step are explained in the solutions of sample problems. Your understanding will be tested with an assessment to ensure you fully grasp the methods used in pre-calculus.

The basics of algebra - such as imaginary and complex numbers, as well as rational expressions - are also covered. By the end, you should be comfortable with solving fundamental problems in pre-calculus. This is a College Level Examination Program (CLEP) course that is open to all.

Start Course Now
